skill.name: quiz-generator
skill.description:
Generate 50-question interactive quizzes using the Quiz component with randomized batching.
Use when creating end-of-chapter assessments. Displays 15-20 questions per session with
immediate feedback. NOT for static markdown quizzes.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. Reference documentation for quiz generation methodology. The Python scripts for answer redistribution are utility tools that only parse and modify local markdown files.

content.value_statement: Creating assessment questions that test understanding requires significant effort. This skill provides a structured methodology to generate 50 college-level conceptual questions with balanced answer distribution, equal-length options, and immediate feedback explanations.
actual_capabilities: Generate 50 conceptual questions per chapter at Apply level or higher
Balance answer distribution across 4 options (12-13 per index)
Validate option lengths within ¬±3 words to prevent guessing
Format quizzes for the Quiz component with JSX syntax
Redistribute answers using provided Python scripts
limitations: Does not access lesson content automatically - questions must be authored manually
Does not validate technical accuracy against source material
Does not test the Quiz component rendering
Requires manual word count verification for all options

use_cases.title: End-of-chapter assessments
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive 50-question quizzes to evaluate student understanding after completing chapter material.

use_cases.title: Documentation quality checks
use_cases.description: Generate quizzes to verify documentation clarity and identify topics needing additional explanation.

use_cases.title: Spaced repetition banks
use_cases.description: Build large question banks enabling repeated practice with different question batches each session.

prompt_templates.title: Basic quiz request
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 50-question conceptual quiz for Chapter [X] on [topic]. Follow the Quiz Generator skill guidelines with 75%+ Apply level questions, balanced answer distribution, and 100-150 word explanations.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed quiz request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 50-question quiz for Chapter [X] covering [specific lessons/topics]. Ensure each question tests understanding, not recall. Include source attribution for each question. Verify all options are within ¬±3 words.

prompt_templates.title: Quiz with distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 50 questions where correct answers follow Sequence [A-H] for even distribution (12-13 per option). Format for Quiz component. Include comprehensive explanations addressing all distractors.

prompt_templates.title: Validation request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the attached quiz file against the quality checklist. Verify: 50 questions, correctOption indices 0-3, 12-13 per option, all options within ¬±3 words, source field on all 50, and 100-150 word explanations.

output_examples.input: Generate a 10-question conceptual quiz on Python variables
output: Q1: After running `name = 'Alice'; name = 'Bob'`, what happens to memory?
B: Both strings remain in memory; name now points to 'Bob'
C: Memory location is overwritten in place
D: Reference count drops to zero
Answer: B - Python creates new string objects; old values persist until garbage collection

best_practices: Always verify answer distribution manually (12-13 per option for 50 questions)
Count words for all options in every question to ensure ¬±3 word range
Include source attribution in 'Lesson N: Title' format for every question
Use immediate feedback model with 100-150 word explanations addressing all options
anti_patterns: Using 1-4 indices instead of 0-3 for correctOption
Accepting uneven answer distribution (allows pattern guessing)
Creating questions that test recall instead of understanding

faq.question: What question count is required?
faq.answer: Exactly 50 questions. This enables batching (15-20 per session) and meaningful retakes with new content each time.

faq.question: How are answers distributed?
faq.answer: Each option (0-3) should appear 12-13 times. No 3+ consecutive same answers. Use redistribution scripts for even patterns.

faq.question: What option length rule applies?
faq.answer: All 4 options must be within ¬±3 words of each other. Manually count words for all 50 questions.

faq.question: Is data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill. Quiz content exists only in your conversation and files you create.

faq.question: Why do my quizzes fail validation?
faq.answer: Common issues: wrong index values (use 0-3 not 1-4), missing source fields, uneven distribution, or options exceeding ¬±3 word range.

faq.question: How is this different from other quiz tools?
faq.answer: Focuses on conceptual understanding (Apply/Analyze levels), includes immediate feedback with comprehensive explanations, and enables spaced repetition through batching.
